recipes.cooking_method: The recipe is quite straightforward. There is no baking here. The dessert is cooked on the stovetop, Make the syrup,Prepare kadaif pastry,Assemble,Cook the dessert

Cook spaghetti according to package instructions. Meanwhile, in a food processor, combine basil, parmesan, pine nuts, and garlic. Pulse until mixture is finely chopped. Gradually pour in olive oil, and pulse until smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Drain spaghetti and return to the pot. Toss with pesto sauce until well coated. Garnish with cherry tomatoes, if desired.

Start by cutting the eggplants and zucchinis into bite-sized cubes. Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic, sauté for a few minutes until they become translucent. Add the cubed eggplants and zucchinis and cook for 10-15 minutes until they soften. Add diced tomatoes, tomato paste, red and green bell peppers, salt, and pepper. Stir well and cover the pan. Cook for another 15-20 minutes until all vegetables are cooked and well combined. Serve hot or at room temperature.

ingredients: Tomato sauce, yogurt, and parsley for serving
recipes.cooking_method: In a large bowl, mix together the ground lamb, grated onion, minced garlic, bread crumbs, melted butter, paprika, cumin, salt, and pepper. Knead well with your hands for 5-10 minutes. Divide the mixture into long cylinders, about 6-8 inches long. Preheat your grill or oven to 400°F. Grill or bake the kebabs for 8-10 minutes, or until cooked through. Serve hot with flatbread or lavash bread, tomato sauce, yogurt, and parsley.

Preheat your grill to high heat. Season the Tomahawk steak generously with kosher salt, black pepper, and garlic powder. Drizzle olive oil on both sides of the steak. Grill the steak for 6-8 minutes on each side for medium-rare doneness. During the last 2 minutes of grilling, add fresh rosemary and a pat of unsalted butter on top of the steak. Remove the steak from the grill and let it rest for 5-10 minutes. Slice and serve.

Preheat your oven to 375°F. In a large pan, sauté the chopped onion and minced garlic until soft. Add the beef tenderloin and sear on both sides until browned. In a mixing bowl, combine the tomato paste, red pepper paste, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. Brush the beef tenderloin with the spice mixture. Transfer the beef tenderloin to a baking dish and add the butter on top. Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the beef tenderloin is cooked to your desired level of doneness. Slice and serve.

In a mixing bowl, combine the ground beef, grated onion, minced garlic, Worcestershire sauce, ketchup, dijon mustard, salt, and pepper. Mix until well combined. Form the beef mixture into 2 patties. Preheat your grill or pan to high heat. Grill or pan-fry the burgers for 3-4 minutes on each side for medium-rare doneness. During the last minute of cooking, add a slice of cheddar cheese on top of each burger. Toast the brioche buns. Assemble the burgers by spreading mayonnaise and ketchup on the buns. Add the lettuce, tomato slices, bacon, and the grilled burger patty. Serve hot.

Preheat grill to medium-high heat. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, garlic, rosemary, thyme, salt, and pepper. Brush mixture over both sides of lamb chops. Grill lamb chops for 3-4 minutes on each side for medium-rare, or until cooked to your desired doneness. Let lamb chops rest for 5 minutes before serving.

In a large bowl, combine flour, yeast, sugar, warm water, and olive oil. Knead for 5-10 minutes, then let the dough rest for 30 minutes. Preheat your oven to 450°F. In a separate bowl, mix together the ground lamb, chopped onion, minced garlic, chopped tomatoes, tomato paste, paprika, cumin, salt, and pepper. Divide the dough into small balls. Roll each ball out into a thin, circular shape. Spread the lamb mixture on top of each dough circle. Bake for 8-10 minutes, or until the dough is crispy and the lamb is cooked through. Serve hot.

Preheat your oven to 375°F. In a large pan, sauté the chopped onion and chopped spinach with olive oil for 5-7 minutes, or until the spinach is wilted. Remove from heat and let cool. In a large bowl, mix together the spinach mixture, crumbled feta cheese, chopped parsley, salt, and pepper. Grease a baking dish with melted butter. Lay out one sheet of phyllo dough and brush it with melted butter. Add another sheet of phyllo dough on top and brush it with melted butter as well. Repeat this process with 5-6 sheets of phyllo dough. Spread the spinach mixture on top of the phyllo dough layers. Roll the phyllo dough into a tight log. Brush the top of the log with melted butter and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the top is golden brown. Serve hot or at room temperature.

In a large pot, sauté the chopped onion and minced garlic with olive oil for 5-7 minutes, or until the onion is soft. Add the red lentils, water or chicken stock, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and let simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the lentils are soft and cooked through. Use an immersion blender or transfer to a blender and puree until smooth. Serve hot with lemon wedges.

Preheat your oven to 375°F. In a large pan, sauté the chopped onion, minced garlic, and chopped red bell pepper with olive oil for 5-7 minutes, or until the vegetables are soft. Add the peeled and deveined shrimp, canned chopped tomatoes, paprika, cumin, salt, and pepper. Cook for an additional 5-7 minutes, or until the shrimp are pink and cooked through. Grease a baking dish with melted butter. Lay out one sheet of phyllo dough and brush it with melted butter. Add another sheet of phyllo dough on top and brush it with melted butter as well. Repeat this process with 5-6 sheets of phyllo dough. Spread the shrimp mixture on top of the phyllo dough layers. Roll the phyllo dough into a tight log. Brush the top of the log with melted butter. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown. Serve hot.

ingredients: 1/2 lb fresh fish fillets (such as sea bass, sea bream, or mackerel)
recipes.cooking_method: In a shallow bowl, mix together cornmeal, flour, salt, and pepper. Coat the fish fillets in the mixture, shaking off any excess. Heat olive oil in a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the fish and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side or until golden brown and cooked through. Split the bread rolls and layer the lettuce, tomatoes, red onion, and cooked fish inside. Serve immediately.

ingredients: 1 small red bell pepper, finely chopped
1 small green bell pepper, finely chopped
recipes.cooking_method: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Roll out the pizza dough into a long oval shape. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and bell peppers, and cook for 3-4 minutes or until softened. Season with salt, black pepper, and oregano. Spread the cooked vegetables over the pizza dough, leaving a border around the edges. Sprinkle the feta and mozzarella cheese over the vegetables. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve hot.

Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add eggplants and zucchinis, and cook for 10-12 minutes or until softened and lightly browned. Remove from the skillet and set aside. Add onion and red bell pepper to the same skillet, and cook for 5-7 minutes or until softened. Add minced garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes or until fragrant. Stir in diced tomatoes, tomato paste, paprika, cumin, and red pepper flakes. Return the eggplants and zuc

Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add eggplants and zucchinis, and cook for 10-12 minutes or until softened and lightly browned. Remove from the skillet and set aside. Add onion and red bell pepper to the same skillet, and cook for 5-7 minutes or until softened. Add minced garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes or until fragrant. Stir in diced tomatoes, tomato paste, paprika, cumin, and red pepper flakes. Return the eggplants and zuc

Wash the mussels and drain them in a colander. Rinse the rice and drain. Chop the onion. Finely chop the parsley. Heat the olive oil in a saucepan and sauté the onions until they are soft. Add the tomato and pepper paste and stir. Add the rice and stir for 2-3 minutes. Add 2 cups of hot water, salt, and black pepper. Cook the rice until it absorbs all the water. Let the rice cool down. Add chopped parsley and mix. Fill each mussel with the rice mixture. Arrange the stuffed mussels in a large pot. Add enough water to cover the mussels. Cook over medium heat for 30-40 minutes. Serve with lemon wedges.

Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F). Peel and cut the potatoes into wedges or cubes. In a large bowl, mix together olive oil, salt, black pepper, oregano, thyme, and minced garlic. Add the potatoes to the bowl and toss them until they are coated with the mixture. Arrange the potatoes in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake for 30-40 minutes, or until the potatoes are golden brown and crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. Serve hot.
